title: What To Expect, As U.S. And Iran Resume Nuclear Talks
teaser: This weekend, Secretary of State John Kerry will meet with his Iranian counterpart for the fourth time this year to broker a deal.
contentencoded:
Iran and the U.S. will resume talks on Tehran’s highly contested nuclear program in Geneva this weekend.

The State Department says Secretary of State John Kerry will meet his Iranian counterpart, Foreign Minister Mohammed Javad Zarif, for the fourth time this year to broker a deal that could end significant sanctions against Tehran and limit the country’s nuclear capabilities.

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson spoke with Karim Sajadpour of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace about what to expect.

Guest

  • Karim Sadjadpour, senior associate in the Middle East Program at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace. He tweets @ksadjadpour.
